snippet: The Syrian president was pressured to be more flexible about the future of his ravaged country, and to talk with his adversaries.
abstract: Russia pressures Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria to be more flexible about the future of his ravaged country, insisting that he talk with adversaries, inviting an anti-Assad delegation to the Kremlin and restricting shipments of new weapons to the armed forces; developments appear to signal that Russia, Syrian government’s most important foreign backer, may be laying the basis for the option of eventually distancing itself from Assad.

byline.original: By DALAL MAWAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Dalal Mawad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Beirut, and David M. Herszenhorn and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The Syrian president was pressured to be more flexible about the future of his ravaged country, and to talk with his adversaries.

headline.seo: Russia Sends Message of Impatience to Syria’s Assad
headline.main: Russia Prods Syria’s President Assad With Message of Growing Impatience
headline.print_headline: Russia Prods Syria’s President Assad With Message of Growing Impatience

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
